Key Match Events: Elias Mokwana scored a 33rd-minute goal for Bafana Bafana
Bafana Bafana's talisman Themba Zwane had a strike parried over the bar by Congo keeper Ethan Vimalin
Rushwin Dortley had a header cleared off the line after connecting well with Oswin Appolli's corner kick
Andre Bassouamina levelled matters deep into referee's optional time
Pre-Game Insights: Bafana Bafana were expected to wallop Congo after trashing them 5-0 in Gqeberha last Friday
Congo had to win this match to keep their hopes of qualifying alive
Post-Match Reflections: Bafana still have a better chance than Congo to qualify
The Congolese have to win against South Sudan and Uganda to have a chance of overtaking Bafana who are four points ahead going into the last two qualifiers
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was played on a bumpy artificial pitch
Bafana's captain Ronwen Williams expects a fightback from Congo at home
Others: Bafana Bafana's Iqraam Rayners challenges Merveil Ndockyt of Congo in their 2025 Africa Cup of Nations qualifying match
Bafana coach Broos was forced to bring in striker Iqraam Rayners for Lyle Foster who was injured on Friday and didn't travel with the team to Brazzaville
